questions.question: What is the general objective of the lecture on normal labor?
options: To develop a comprehensive understanding of normal labor
To focus only on postpartum care

questions.question: True labor pains are characterized by contractions that:
options: Are irregular and do not increase in intensity

options: Pain in abdomen and lower back

options: Sensation of decreased abdominal distention after fetal head descent

questions.question: The duration of a contraction is measured from:
options: Start of increment to end of decrement
Start of acme to end of acme

Normal labor must be completed within 18 hours.
A precipitate labor lasts less than 3 hours.

A transverse lie is a normal finding at term.
Fetal attitude is normally one of flexion.
The fetal station is measured in centimeters above or below the ischial spines.

The Progesterone Withdrawal Theory suggests an increase in progesterone starts labor.

Prostaglandins are known to relax the uterine muscles.

The 'Passenger' is one of the factors affecting labor.
